727313f-b.title: Queens: Main Street - 37th Avenue
727313f-b.text:
Main Street, west side, south from 37th Avenue, showing
two views of Flushing's main shopping street.
July 10, 1936
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

727313f-a.title: Queens: Main Street - 37th Avenue
727313f-a.text:
Main Street, west side, south from 37th Avenue, showing
two views of Flushing's main shopping street.
July 10, 1936
Views 1,2

727316f-a.title: Queens: Main Street - 37th Avenue
727316f-a.text:
Main Street, east side, between 38th and 37th Avenues,
showing the Taft Theatre, a motion picture house on Flushing's
main business thoroughfare. Houses owned by T. Ellis stood here
in 1873.
P. L. Sperr  August 24, 1935
NO REPRODUCTIOS

727315f-a.title: Queens: Main Street - 37th Avenue
727315f-a.text:
Main Street, east side, north of Thirty-seventh Ave., showing in
the foreground (No. 3O), a 2-story brick building bearing the sign
''Join Our Hoosier Club.'' It was upon this site that the First M.E.
Church was erected. This building was subsequently moved to Fortieth
Ave., between Main and Union Streets, on the west side of the Armory on
the north side of the street.
1922.
Eumene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

727312f-a.title: Queens: Main Street - 37th Avenue
727312f-a.text:
Main Street; west side, between Thirty-seventh Ave. (left) and
Northern Boulevard (right), showing an old 32 -story frame hip-roofed
house said to have been built, according to the City Club Guide, at
the end of the 18th Century. This building in 1923 was renovated,
its front changed to brick and the hip taken out of the roof,sub-
stituting a flat roof therefor. IIt was then known as the Riesenburger
Building and was No. 27 Main Street. It was demolished in 1933. This
is a set of two views.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

725261f-a.title: Queens: 37th Avenue - Main Street
725261f-a.text:
37th 'Svenue, east from Main Street, in Flushing's
thriving business district.
P. L. Sperr  August 24, 1935
NO REPRODUCTIONS

727314f-a.title: Queens: Main Street - 37th Avenue
727314f-a.text:
Main St., west side, north of 37th Ave., showing an old
home at the rears of 35 and 72 Main St. and Thirty-seventh Ave.
Nrespectively. It was moved back when Folletts store, a brick
structure was erected on its site.
1922
Eucene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

725259f-a.title: Queens: 37th Avenue - Main Street
725259f-a.text:
110 Wuirty-seventh Ave., north side, east of Main Street,
showing the Barto Homestead in which, in 1934, a Barto still
resided.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
